{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-127-06-B |Item_parent=Benign prostatic hypertrophy |Item_parent_short=Benign prostatic hypertrophy |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the paraclinical investigations to be carried out in the first instance |Description=ECBU, flow meter, post-mictional residue |Rubric=Additional tests |Contributors=Alexandre Ingels, Jonathan Olivier |Order=6}} ==The paraclinical investigations to be carried out as a first-line assessment of BPH are:== *''ECBU:''' is used to test for [[Haematuria|a haematuria 260]], [[Benign prostatic hyperplasia|urinary tract infection 161]] (differential diagnoses of BPH).
*Flowmetry:''' is used to identify urinary disorders and incontinence in adults and the elderly|dysuria 125]]. The key parameters in its interpretation are the maximum flow rate and the shape of the curve. **A urine volume >150mL provides a more reliable assessment. **A maximum flow rate < 15ml/s is considered pathological. **A normal curve is bell-shaped, whereas a flat curve indicates an emptying disorder.
[[File:Item 127.jpg|vignette|611x611px|alt=|neant]] *Post-micturition residue: the presence of a significant quantity of urine (more than 100ml) in the bladder after micturition. It is assessed using ultrasound or a device such as Bladder Scan©. A post-micturition residue is not in itself an indication for surgery, especially as a residue may be linked to subvesical obstruction or bladder hypoactivity.

question.title: What is the primary purpose of the post-micturition residue test in the assessment of Benign Prostatic Hypertrophy (BPH)?
question.description: The post-micturition residue test is used to assess

option_a.title: To measure the maximum flow rate
option_a.description: This option is related to flowmetry

option_b.title: To detect haematuria and urinary tract infection
option_b.description: This option is related to ECU

option_c.title: To assess the shape of the urine curve
option_c.description: This option is related to flowmetry

option_d.title: To evaluate the presence of post-micturition residue
option_d.description: This option is the correct answer

correct_option.title: d
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
